intro: Hermbstaedtia rogersii, commonly known as the Rogers' hermbstaedtia, is a rare flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its delicate, showy flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in woodland habitats. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is protected in several states.
